results.title: Royal tour of Queen Elizabeth II
results.brief_description: In 1954, huge crowds greeted Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip on her Australian tour, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

constellations_primary.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_primary.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

results.description: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.
description_for_label: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.
